title: Ireland's new national air quality forecast goes live today - TheJournal.ie
summary: The EPA has launched a national air quality forecast online to help the public plan outdoor activities while minimizing exposure to poor air quality. The forecast utilizes data from monitoring stations across Ireland to assess and predict air quality levels based on specific pollutants. This resource aims to inform individuals, particularly those with respiratory conditions, about air quality, thereby contributing to public health. The forecast maps are generated from models developed under the EU Life Emerald project.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the air quality forecast promotes environmental sustainability by helping people reduce exposure to air pollution, thus supporting public health and awareness regarding air quality management.
business_innovation: FALSE, because the article does not describe a new or significantly improved product or business process but rather a service provided by a government agency.
green_product: FALSE, because the article does not describe a specific good or service that is designed to reduce environmental impact; it is focused on providing information about air quality.
green_process: TRUE, because the development and use of computer models to forecast air quality represents a method aimed at minimizing environmental impacts and promoting sustainability through better air quality management.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 921120 - Legislative Bodies, 923120 - Administration of Public Health Programs, 541620 - Environmental Consulting Services, 541715 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences (except Nanotechnology and Biotechnology)
greenwashing: FALSE, because the article does not involve misleading claims about environmental benefits; it presents a legitimate initiative aimed at improving public health and environmental awareness.
